Leaking this from the com.intellij.openapi.wm.impl.status.EditorBasedWidget's init block and causes this issue.
Though not sure if this should be fixed in EditorBasedWidget side to avoid this issue or in FlowJSStatusBarWidget.

abstract class EditorBasedWidget protected constructor(
  init {
    @Suppress("LeakingThis")
    registerCustomListeners(myConnection)
  }
...

public final class FlowJSStatusBarWidget extends EditorBasedStatusBarPopup {
  protected void registerCustomListeners(@NotNull MessageBusConnection connection) {
    connection.subscribe(DumbService.DUMB_MODE, new DumbService.DumbModeListener() {
      @Override
      public void exitDumbMode() {
        FlowJSStatusBarWidget.this.update();
      }
    });
  }

  open fun update(finishUpdate: Runnable?) {
    check(update.tryEmit(finishUpdate))
  }

Hi all, I am trying to reproduce this issue but I still fail to reproduce this issue. It seems this is an issue only related to some web projects.
If you see this issue again, please find your project id in your project's .idea/workspace.xml file's ProjectId tag (e.g. <component name="ProjectId" id="2Ht1rm9xObYVMF2N9zv1s99yWUR" /> in .idea/workspace.xml).
Then share the <IDE_CONFIG_FOLDER>/workspace/<ProjectId>.xml (replace the <ProjectId> with the project ID you saw in above step).
If your project (which failed to open) doesn't have sensitive info, please zip it and share it for checking. Thanks a lot.

Hi Lejia, have you seen my "duplicate" issue, that is linked to this one (IDEA-327452). I can reproduce it with starting a fresh Vue project (using pycharm), use the debugger once and than restart the IDE. Without using the debugger it does not occur (than restarting the IDE works fine)

","created":1691419353499,"updated":null,"id":"27-7977008","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Markus_Sitzmann.gtri","name":"markus.sitzmann","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

","created":1691423662166,"updated":null,"id":"27-7977392","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Markus_Sitzmann.gtri","name":"markus.sitzmann","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

What I also can report is that it must not happen on the first restart of the IDE, sometimes the project survives several restarts, I have a weak feeling not quitting/stopping a debug session properly (by stopping all currently running run configurations) this increases the chance that the project gets into this non-restarting status.

","created":1691586495374,"updated":null,"id":"27-7984057","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"lejia.chen","name":"Lejia Chen","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Reproduced in the IDEA 2023.2 in Linux.

Steps:

  1. Unzip the sample project vue-box.tar.gz in this issue.
  2. Open it in the IDEA 2023.2.
  3. Close this project.
  4. Unzip the 2Tf6M7bLLu5JLnsvnki5CILTxlF.xml.gz, and copy the 2Tf6M7bLLu5JLnsvnki5CILTxlF.xml into <IDE_CONFIG>/workspace/.
  5. Restart the IDEA and open this project from the welcome screen.

From my testing, it seems the below part in 2Tf6M7bLLu5JLnsvnki5CILTxlF.xml cause this issue.

  <component name="FileEditorManager">
    <leaf>
      <file current-in-tab="false">
        <entry file="http://localhost:5173/src/main.js">
          <provider selected="true" editor-type-id="httpFileEditor" />
        </entry>
      </file>
    </leaf>
  </component>

","tags":[],"id":"25-4718160","$type":"Issue","workItems":[]}, {"created":1689588374890,"resolved":null,"attachments":[],"project":{"shortName":"IDEA","$type":"Project"},"updated":1691579973251,"reporter":{"login":"niknetniko","$type":"User"},"summary":"Font size for custom UI font does not scale with system scale factor","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"gaiane.varvashtian","name":"Gaiane Varvashtian","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Reproduced: on KDE x11.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Set custom font (i.e. Ubuntu 13)
  2. Change monitor scale (i.e. from 1.0 to 2.0)
  3. Restart OS (if needed)
  4. Open IDE and check UI font

Actual result: Font size = Ubuntu 13

Expected result: Font size = Ubuntu 26

My apologies if a duplicate already exists, I did not find the same issue, especially considering this seems to be a regression in the 2023.2 beta.

What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Set a custom font and font size in Intellij.
2. Use another display (e.g. a 4K external monitor) or change the scaling factor in the system settings.
3. Open Intellij
What is the expected result?

The custom font's size should scale according to the scaling factor set in the system settings. For example, when using font size 13 on 100%, it should become font size 17 on 125%.

What happens instead?

The font size stays the same. The editor font (for which I am not using a custom font) does scale properly.

This used to work in Intellij 2023.1, but doesn't in 2023.2 beta.

Please attach the IDE logs to the issue. You can get them by selecting Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data from the Help menu.

Since the issue is fixed when I manually changed the font size, unsure if logs are going to add much, but I can try to get logs when it happens if needed.

If you can’t provide IDE logs, please provide information about the IDE version and the OS you are using. You can copy these details from the About dialog in the Help or App menu.

After setting tasks Jira integration, I occasionally see this stacktrace showing in the errors

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Set up Jira in the Tasks | Server

    • Add server, e.g. https://myconpany.atlassian.net/jira
    • email: a valid email
    • API Token: an api token

    I'm not even sure valid values are necessary to trigger the NoClassDefFoundError, as this seems like a packaging issue.

  2. After some times, usually after a restart but not always, there's an internal error

What is the expected result?
No errors.

What happens instead?
Internal error in plugin Task Management

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/commons/httpclient/Credentials

Hmmmmm...perhaps stand down on this one for the moment. It looks like perhaps it's happening due to a third-party library being loaded via a custom classloader causing SLF4J to use a no-op logger. I've confirmed that this exact same logic doesn't cause this to occur in 2023.1 and earlier so it is a behavioral change, but since it's something my plugin is doing, let me investigate a bit and see if I can figure out how to prevent it from happening in 2023.2. Fun with custom classloaders...yay...

It's definitely a me-problem. Sorry for the noise!

","created":1691519108868,"updated":null,"id":"27-7981576","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"illuminatedcloud","name":"Scott Wells","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

So there may actually be something to this after all. Obviously all plugin code should be getting loggers using com.intellij.openapi.diagnostic.Logger#getInstance(java.lang.Class<?>|String), but obviously many third-party libs that might be bundled with a plugin could be using SLF4J and therefore getting loggers using org.slf4j.LoggerFactory#getLogger(java.lang.Class<?>|String). It seems that when that occurs, a LinkageError is thrown due to mismatched class instances:

Caused by: java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: when resolving method 'org.slf4j.ILoggerFactory org.slf4j.impl.StaticLoggerBinder.getLoggerFactory()' the class loader com.intellij.ide.plugins.cl.PluginClassLoader @27da0c6e of the current class, org/slf4j/LoggerFactory, and the class loader com.intellij.util.lang.PathClassLoader @6debcae2 for the method's defining class, org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder, have different Class objects for the type org/slf4j/ILoggerFactory used in the signature (org.slf4j.LoggerFactory is in unnamed module of loader com.intellij.ide.plugins.cl.PluginClassLoader @27da0c6e, parent loader 'bootstrap'; org.slf4j.impl.StaticLoggerBinder is in unnamed module of loader com.intellij.util.lang.PathClassLoader @6debcae2)
	at org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getILoggerFactory(LoggerFactory.java:423)
	at org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger(LoggerFactory.java:362)
	at org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger(LoggerFactory.java:388)
	...

My guess is that you can reproduce this pretty easily by adding the following to any plugin code:

org.slf4j.Logger slf4jLogger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ClassName.class);

For all intents and purposes, that's what's causing my issue here. As a (mostly failed) workaround, I added the third-party library's own slf4j-api.jar to the custom classloader's classpath, and while that keeps this exception from being thrown by code executing in that custom classloader that uses SLF4J, it also halts all logging because SLF4J fails to find org.slf4j.impl.StaticLoggerBinder in the classpath and degrades to the NOP logger.

If I instead remove that slf4j-api.jar such that the custom classloader picks up org.slf4j.* from the parent classloader, I see the LinkageError described above. However, as I mentioned, that LinkageError occurs even in the absence of a custom classloader, so I think if that were resolved, my issue would no longer exist.

I'm still trying to figure out what to do, but I thought I'd point out that the root cause of this--the LinkageError for any code running in a PluginClassLoader that tries to use SLF4J directly--seems like a more endemic problem, no? Or hopefully I'm still missing something obvious and there's an easy solution?

","created":1691522258001,"updated":null,"id":"27-7981676","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"illuminatedcloud","name":"Scott Wells","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

A little additional information on this...after extensive debugging of the actual classloading of org.slf4j.LoggerFactory, I'm finding that even when there's a jar in the classpath that includes that class, the classloader ends up using the one that was already loaded by the IDE's root classloader. To be specific, here's where the custom UrlClassLoader actually loads the LoggerFactory class definition from an external third-party jar:

and this is the result of classConsumer.consumeClassData(className, bytes) where classConsumer is my instance of UrlClassLoader:

As you can see, the IDE's own version of that class is always loaded. However, if my custom UrlClassLoader also delegates to the parent classloader for org.slf4j.StaticLoggingBinder, I get the LinkageError mentioned above. That's what this is causing SLF4J to switch to a NOP logger even at the root level, thereby stopping further logging.

I have no idea what to do here since I can't actually force my custom classloader to use its own LoggerFactory. Any thoughts from folks there are greatly appreciated.

This one is kind of weird, but I've noticed in 2023.2 that the debug IDE instance launched from my dev IDE instance stops logging anything new pretty shortly after being started. It's worth noting that I have a large set of entries in Help > Diagnostic Tools > Debug Log Settings, but it's the same set I've always used during development. Even changing the set of entries in that dialog, which would typically immediately result in a new logged entry like the following:

2023-08-08 11:59:33,256 [   1436]   INFO - #c.i.d.DebugLogManager - Set DEBUG for the following categories: ...

doesn't cause any new logging to appear, either in the idea.log tab of the IDE's debugger or in the physical idea.log file produced by Help > Show Log in Explorer. I don't see any new logging until I stop and restart the debug IDE instance.

Any thoughts on why this might be happening? Not having an active idea.log is kind of hurting my plugin dev productivity. Hopefully it's just something I've done, though I don't know what that would be since I'm doing things exactly the same way I have in the past. Thoughts?

","created":1593081539159,"updated":null,"id":"27-4218353","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"egor.klepikov","name":"Egor Klepikov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

https://jbs.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/3135141

What I did.

  1. stop all IDEA instances
  2. rm -rf .idea directory from alme-poc-tuning directory
  3. start IDEA, then check it has the correct groovy code style settings , which it does. I think from Default IDE settings.
  4. restart IDEA, check groovy code style, the problem reoccurred.

I noticed that in step 3, when I check the settings, the .idea directory is created.

Then I recalled you said remove the .idea, then create a new project from existing sources. So I did that. Same pattern occurred. It worked the first time, I closed and reopened and the wrong settings where there.

Next I tried to export the code style to a file. That also created project.xml file in .idea along with the codeStyleConfig.xml. For some reason, that seems to have fixed it. I closed and reopened several times and the settings persist.

","created":1613720130064,"updated":null,"id":"27-4704951","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"alexander.doroshko","name":"Alexander Doroshko","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

.idea/codeStyles should be a folder, but according to logs, it's a file. Workaround is to close the IDE and delete .idea/codeStyles file. All should work fine after that.

The reasons why .idea/codeStyles file appeared is not yet clear, unfortunately.

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.1.1 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-201.7223.91, built on April 30, 2020
Runtime version: 11.0.6+8-b765.40 amd64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Windows 10 10.0
Non-Bundled Plugins: Lombook Plugin, com.dubreuia, org.sonarlint.idea, com.mallowigi, org.jetbrains.kotlin, izhangzhihao.rainbow.brackets, com.chrisrm.idea.MaterialThemeUI

When editing and saving code style for respected languages, and hitting apply and save they are not saved to .idea.

To reproduce

Create a new project (can be spring boot or watever)
Edit Java code style 'tab and indents' settings to be something different than default values. Click apply and then save.
Close IDEA
Open project again and when u enter the code styles settings, they are reset.

To force creation of the code style project level settings, one have to delete file from .idea dir, then when saving new settings IDEA creates a proper folder structure (i assume it is proper, since it works afterwards)

When trying to install Plugins via File > Settings... > Plugins > Marketplace, the proxy settings are not considered. This means that IDEA tries to connect directly to plugins.jetbrains.com, which is blocked:

PluginDownloader - PluginDownloader error: Cannot download 'https://plugins.jetbrains.com/pluginManager/?id=com.microsoft.tooling.msservices.intellij.azure&build=IU-221.5591.52&uuid=120522198faf190-2c75-4907-bfca-ca246f55b9ab': Read timed out

The same holds for all HTTP accesses done by IntelliJ IDEA, such as vulnerability reports:

2022-05-30 16:43:12,009 [21647935] WARN - o.j.s.VulnerabilitiesRepositoryServer - Unexpected server error
io.ktor.network.sockets.ConnectTimeoutException: Connect timeout has expired [url=https://vulnerability-search.europe-north1-gke.intellij.net//api/v2/vulnerabilities/cx, connect_timeout=5000 ms]

The certificates of the proxy server are imported, so that is not the issue. In addition, the exception stacktrace does not show a certificate exception, but rather a connection failure. This indicates that for the mentioned non-working functionality of installing plugins and the background vulnerability check, the proxy settings are ignored completely. The plugin installer doesn't get to a point where certificates are checked.

Also, please note that the connection works in in principle when doing a connection test from the proxy settings screen.

The log file after debug settings were added.
idea (16).log

Here is a small reproducible example:

kt
package org.jetbrains.plugins.scala.lang.findUsages

import com.intellij.openapi.util.DummyIcon
import com.intellij.openapi.util.Iconable
import com.intellij.psi.PsiMethod
import com.intellij.psi.impl.ElementPresentationUtil
import com.intellij.psi.impl.source.PsiClassImpl
import com.intellij.psi.util.PsiTreeUtil
import com.intellij.testFramework.fixtures.LightJavaCodeInsightFixtureTestCase
import com.intellij.ui.IconManager
import com.intellij.ui.LayeredIcon
import com.intellij.ui.icons.CachedImageIcon
import com.intellij.ui.icons.RowIcon

class MyTestIconsDisabled : MyTestBase() {
    override fun isIconRequired(): Boolean = false

    fun test1() {
        val manager = IconManager.getInstance()
        assertEquals("com.intellij.ui.DummyIconManager", manager.javaClass.name)
    }
}

class MyTestIconsEnabled : MyTestBase() {
    override fun isIconRequired(): Boolean = true

    fun test1() {
        val manager = IconManager.getInstance()
        assertEquals("com.intellij.ui.icons.CoreIconManager", manager.javaClass.name)

        val method = getMethodElement()

        val flagsVisibility = Iconable.ICON_FLAG_VISIBILITY
        val flagsAll = flagsVisibility
                .or(0x4000) //ElementPresentationUtil.FLAGS_RUNNABLE
                .or(0x2000) //ElementPresentationUtil.FLAGS_JUNIT_TEST
                .or(0x400) //ElementPresentationUtil.FLAGS_FINAL
                .or(0x200) //ElementPresentationUtil.FLAGS_STATIC

        val methodIcon = com.intellij.util.PlatformIcons.METHOD_ICON
        val layeredIcon1 = manager.createLayeredIcon(method, methodIcon, flagsVisibility)
        val layeredIcon2 = manager.createLayeredIcon(method, methodIcon, flagsAll)

        assertEquals(
                "nodes/method.svg",
                presentIconLayers(layeredIcon1)
        )

        assertEquals(
                """nodes/method.svg
                  |nodes/staticMark.svg
                  |nodes/finalMark.svg
                  |nodes/junitTestMark.svg
                  |nodes/runnableMark.svg
                  |""".trimMargin().trim(),
                presentIconLayers(layeredIcon2)
        )

        println()
    }

    @Suppress("UnstableApiUsage")
    private fun presentIconLayers(icon: RowIcon): String {
        val allLayers = (icon.allIcons[0] as LayeredIcon).allLayers
        val layersTexts = allLayers.map {
            when (it) {
                is CachedImageIcon -> it.originalPath
                is DummyIcon -> it.toString()
                else -> TODO()
            }
        }
        return layersTexts.joinToString("\n")
    }
}

abstract class MyTestBase : LightJavaCodeInsightFixtureTestCase() {
    override fun setUp() {
        super.setUp()

        myFixture.configureByText(
                "Example.java",
                """public class Example {
                  |  private static final void foo() {}
                  |}
                  |""".trimMargin()
        )

        //Init ElementPresentationUtil class and invoke "static" block
        try {
            ElementPresentationUtil.addVisibilityIcon(null, 0, null)
        } catch (_: NullPointerException) {
            //ignore
        }
    }

    /** @return psi element of `foo` method */
    protected fun getMethodElement(): PsiMethod {
        val clazz = PsiTreeUtil.findChildOfType(myFixture.file, PsiClassImpl::class.java)!!
        return clazz.ownMethods[0]!!
    }
}

org.jetbrains.plugins.scala.lang.findUsages.MyTestIconsEnabled
and then org.jetbrains.plugins.scala.lang.findUsages.MyTestIconsDisabled
the tests will pass:

if you reverse the order the MyTestIconsEnabled will fail:

","created":1691508968718,"updated":null,"id":"27-7981136","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Dmitrii.Naumenko","name":"Dmitrii Naumenko","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

My fix suggestion remains the same.
Initialisation of IconManager should not be done in the static block of ElementPresentationUtil
ElementPresentationUtil should not initialise icon manager in the static block

In theory, this also is actual for the second static block in ElementPresentationUtil which initialise some map from the icon manager:

IMO all this initialisation should be moved to some static method and be invoked from com.intellij.testFramework.UsefulTestCase#setUp

It seems like using IconManager.getInstance() from a static block or from companion object is an anti-pattern.
I used structural search to find more places like that with potential issues.
Another example is com.jetbrains.php.PhpIcons which has a lot of static blocks

Related Slack message in #ij-platform-news channel
https://jetbrains.slack.com/archives/C0CJS122E/p1617611700024200

The production version of IconManager is no longer enabled by default in a unit test mode. This doesn’t mean a performance increase in most cases, since IconLoader has been disabled for a long time anyway, but there is an important difference - createDeferredIcon doesn’t run the passed icon producer, so if you test completion and check the variant icon without enabling the production version of IconManager, for example, the composite icons may be wrong.The good news is that in most cases, no changes are required in the test code, even if you need to check icons. Setting UsefulTestCase.isIconRequired = true is only necessary if you need to test deferred icons, but in that case Registry.get("psi.deferIconLoading").setValue(false) might be a solution (see NashornJSCompletionTest).The rare uses of isIconRequired make sense after this change, but the cleanup is not yet complete. It was more important to fix failed tests than to refactor existing tests.

I've noticed that in Scala Plugin some tests fail depending on the order of execution.
The failing tests test Structure View, including the icons, including layered icons (final/static icon)

The reason is that com.intellij.ui.IconManager.registerIconLayer is called only once in com.intellij.psi.impl.ElementPresentationUtil static initialization block.
Suppose we have two tests:

scala
class Test1 extends UsefulTestCase {
  override def isIconRequired: Boolean = false
}
class Test2 extends UsefulTestCase {
  override def isIconRequired: Boolean = true
}

If Test1 is executed before Test2 , this code in com.intellij.psi.impl.ElementPresentationUtil will initialize DummyIconManager:

When com.intellij.testFramework.UsefulTestCase#setUp is executed for Test2 it will activate the icon manager:

java
IconManager.activate(new CoreIconManager());

but it will not initialize layers for it, causing the tests to fail.

We could probably move the initialization to the com.intellij.ui.CoreIconManager itself, or extract it to some method in ElementPresentationUtil and reinvoke it in UsefulTestCase

@Thomas Bnt the issue with icons appearing as tiny dots might be caused by corrupted icons cache.
Please try the following:

  • Close the IDE
  • Go to IDE system directory and remove all files named "icons-v*.db".
  • Run IDE again.

As to the run window not rendered until mouse hover - could you please indicate how exactly you run the NPM configuration? Does the same issue happen with any other configuration type?
Can you reproduce it after IDE restart?
If possible please share idea.log after reproducing the issue next time. You can locate the log via Help | Show log in Finder. If necessary you can restrict the attachment visibility to jetbrains-team or use our upload service, just let us know the upload ID. Thank you!

Does the issue persist if you disable all the third-party plugins (especially themes)?

Dark Purple Theme (1.3), One Dark theme (5.8.0), WakaTime (14.1.5), Dev Containers (232.8660.202), Toml (232.8660.88), Nuxt.js (2.0.2), Space (232.8660.158), .env files support (2023.2), Deno (232.8660.129), Database Tools and SQL for WebStorm (232.8660.129), .ignore (4.5.1), Prisma ORM (232.8660.129), Gitmoji Plus: Commit Button (1.13.0), Copy Git Link (0.5.2), Discord Integration (1.11.0), Catppuccin Theme (2.2.0), Ideolog (222.1.0.0), GitHub Copilot (1.2.16.2847)

","created":1458811580667,"updated":null,"id":"27-1367871","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Earl.Marwil","name":"Earl Marwil","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"
I see the same problem with my Android projects since upgrading to IDEA 2016. I am currently running IDEA 2016.2.4. I downloaded the example project and it reproduces the problem.

All of my Android projects use gradle to build the app. I don't have this issue with my non-Android projects.

If I remove Java-Gradle and Android-Gradle facets from the Modules in Project Structure for the sample app, and then close and reopen the project, the .idea/.name file does not get deleted. Adding Java-Gradle and Android-Gradle facets back into the modules, the .idea/.name file gets deleted when the project is opened.

So it seems the root cause lies somewhere in the gradle integration with IDEA.
","created":1475980971107,"updated":null,"id":"27-1644117","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Earl.Marwil","name":"Earl Marwil","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"
This blog post (http://mrhaki.blogspot.com/2009/11/gradle-goodness-changing-project-name.html) provides a clue. If you set the project name in the settings.gradle file (not the build.gradle file), rootProject.name='my project name', and then 'sync', the project name is set in the Project Structure and saved in .idea/.name. Sync'ing (refresh button) parses the gradle project structure and updates the IntelliJ project structure.

When the rootProject.name is not explicitly set, gradle uses the name of the directory the project is in as the gradle project name. This seems to be the same convention IntelliJ uses for the Project name in the Project Structure. But if the user sets a project name in Project Structure and gradle uses the default, the .idea/.name file gets deleted whenever the project structure is refreshed. Rather than deleting .name file, wouldn't it be better to rewrite it with the (default) name used by gradle?
","created":1476067224617,"updated":1475980970948,"id":"27-1644637","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"serge","name":"Serge Baranov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"
https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/206570349--idea-name-deleted-on-closing-IDE:

I can reproduce this behavior if I:

  • delete the .gradle directory
  • start the IDE
  • build the project (eg: double-click on "assemble" in the Gradle tool panel)
  • exit the IDE

Since it's standard practice to exclude .gradle from vcs (eg: put it in your .gitignore), it's pretty easy to end up with a working directory without the .gradle subtree (eg: after creating a new working repo, or running git clean -xf), which means IntelliJ IDEA will mysteriously also delete the .idea/.name file after you build.

Historically, we have the following separation: the "interface" and the "bean" EP.

  • "Interface": You specify the implementation class, and the platform is responsible for creating an instance of it.
  • "Bean": You specify the bean class, the platform creates a bean with some data (extensions can define data via XML), and then you can use it as metadata or as a source for some factory (ToolWindowEP).

Some usages of the bean approach are quite complicated, such as tool window and inspection. However, for simple cases where you just need data and don't want to deal with the factory, it is more straightforward.

But what should we do when we want to provide metadata for some existing "interface" EP? Creating a new one would introduce confusion about which one to use, and it would force everyone to transform already working code into something more complicated. Such a barrier has no explanation or background reasons, except for historical ones.

Moreover, we already have use cases where the "interface" EP specifies an abstract class as an interface. During the instance creation, we inject all XML data defined for the extension (that's why the default implementation for all EP is XML-aware; that was the intention from the beginning). When it was broken after a platform refactoring and quickly fixed, it was decided not to break this functionality, as it is quite convenient and logical for clients. Therefore, we have to legitimize this use case, especially considering devkit support and validation.

Internal status is not an excuse for making API not follow generic practices. We are not in a position to forbid the usage of that API for everyone for now.

The internal status allows us to break the existing contract (it is not "when all application level components are initialized" anymore), as it was done (the same cannot be and never will be done for ProjectActivity).

A separate extension point should be added.

Affected both old/new UI.
Also enable "preview tab" - without this it is also reproducible, but not that easy.

STR:

  • Enable the "preview tab" option from the Project view.
  • close all opened files
  • open com/intellij/openapi/application/rw/PlatformReadWriteActionSupport.kt:38
  • navigate to the declaration of runReadAction - it is opened in a preview tab
  • navigate to the declaration of coroutineScope at line 33
  • use back-forward actions several times (using mouse buttons or shortcut can see this issue too)

as a result the file CoroutineScope.kt is opened at the very end sometimes (sometimes not)

  1. Open a file in the Editor
  2. Open Diff in the Editor (e.g. "Open blank diff window" action)
  3. Restart IDE

Reproduced in the 233.2423.
Steps:

  1. Close all the files in tab.
  2. Open a file in IDEA. Split it to the right.
  3. Restart the IDEA, and use the "Goto Next Splitter" in the first file.

Result:
I saw #c.i.o.f.i.EditorsSplitters - Assertion failed and java.lang.Throwable: No window found exception.

Except for the exception in this issue's description, there are also some related exception before it from this user's log.

Pre-IntelliJ .kbdx file was >1MB, post-IntelliJ file is 76KB, implying that all previous password data has been irrevocably lost. I was fortunate enough to be able to recover from a relatively recent backup but any action this destructive should require the user to explicitly acknowledge the consequences beforehand. Allowing the user to specify an existing .kdbx file and not warning that its contents will be cleared out when IntelliJ connects implies that IntelliJ's password entries can coexist with those that already exist in the file, which is clearly not the case.

","created":1580413012320,"updated":null,"id":"27-3922758","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Konstantin.Annikov","name":"Konstantin Annikov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Hello,

","created":1623742435020,"updated":null,"id":"27-4958908","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"dkuehn","name":"Daniel Kühn","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

I have been able to recreate the same behaviour.

In my existing KeePas database under Win10, all passwords were modified/converted and thus unusable. This happened after I selected the existing database in IntelliJ to store IntelliJ passwords. Maybe the behaviour is because the KeePass database was already open in KeePass during the integration at IntelliJ?

But there is a solution!

Create a new empty database in KeePass. Then select the old corrupt database via File>Import>KeePass KDBX(2.x) (Repair Mode). After the import, all entries with the correct passwords are available again.

","created":1652072600874,"updated":null,"id":"27-6060289","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"th33xitus","name":"d w","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Today i encountered the same issue. It took me quite some time to pin down the issue and find out, that PyCharm was the guilty and corrupted my whole database file. I just noticed because i needed one rather old password i don't use regularly to log into a website. And that website responded with a "password invalid". I then checked the database file, had a look in the password entry and made the entry visible. All i saw was some gibberish with exactly the same "?-icons" all over the place. Even the IntelliJ passwords are affected, though i wonder why they still seem to work?!
The following screenshot was made from KeePass, i usually use KeePassXC (both are compatible with each other), but KeePassXC notices if a screenshot tool gets active and the window becomes invisible, so you can't screenshot it. Thats why i used KeePass this time, just for the sake of creating a screenshot.

Sadly, until now, i wasn't able to reproduce the issue with a completely fresh database file. But no doubt, my existing one got compromised by PyCharm. I figured that out because i have around 100 revisions/backups of that database file reaching back up until October 2020, i started using Jetbrains Products some time in 2021 i think. And it seems like that the first time i used the function for saving via KeePass must have been January 8th 2022. Because that was the very first revision of my database file which had the "IntelliJ Platform" group added to the file and all other passwords within that file were corrupted. The database revision before January 8th 2022 was from November 12th 2021 and all passwords are still intact inside of that database file. No "IntelliJ Platform" group, no corrupted passwords.

Anyways, if im able to reproduce the issue somehow, i try to update this ticket. Up until now i can only share my observations. Sadly the solution @Daniel Kühn mentioned didn't work out for me, importing my corrupted database with KeePass in Repair Mode didn't repair my passwords.

So, please excuse me now. I need to try and manually repair my database now...
And for now, i'll probably use a dedicated database file for IntelliJ IDEs and not the one i store my other passwords in, so this won't happen a second time.

","created":1667929348140,"updated":null,"id":"27-6604020","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"th33xitus","name":"d w","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

@Stanislav Tvarůžek use a dedicated keepass database for jetbrains. do not use the same database for your other personal passwords. i think, as long as this issue is still present, that's probably the best advice to give. i did that after my first database was trashed due to this issue and now i don't have any problems anymore. sometimes i still get asked for my github token, although its saved in the database the program has access too, so not sure if that issue is somehow connected to this one, anyways, most of the time it works. probably, even if this issue would be resolved in the future, i'll never use my database that i use for all my other passwords ever again. it's just not worth it and too risky.

","$type":"TextFieldValue"},"projectCustomField":{"emptyFieldText":"No zendesk mentions","$type":"TextProjectCustomField"},"name":"Zendesk mentions","id":"310-125","$type":"TextIssueCustomField"},{"value":4,"projectCustomField":{"emptyFieldText":"0","$type":"SimpleProjectCustomField"},"name":"Linked Support Tickets","id":"113-2431","$type":"SimpleIssueCustomField"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Open Settings, go to Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > Passwords.
  2. Select Save Passwords > In KeePass.
  3. Specify location of existing password database file.
  4. Enter Master Password as prompted.

What is the expected result?

IntelliJ IDEA starts creating new entries in the database for any passwords it needs to save

What happens instead?

All passwords in the .kbdx file are overwritten, including History entries, and replaced with what looks like encrypted data; please see attachment:

There is no warning anywhere in the documentation for this process (https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/reference-ide-settings-password-safe.html) or in the application when setting it up, that existing data in the DB would be modified in any way, and no use case I can think of where modifying existing data in the DB would be required in the first place.

This is similar to the behavior described in IDEA-165257, except that in the current behavior the existing password records are "retained" but unusable.

Version:

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.3.1 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-193.5662.53, built on December 17, 2019
Licensed to [OMITTED]
You have a perpetual fallback license for this version
Subscription is active until November 26, 2020
Runtime version: 11.0.5+10-b520.17 amd64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Windows 8.1 6.3
GC: ParNew, ConcurrentMarkSweep
Memory: 2000M
Cores: 4
Registry: compiler.automake.allow.when.app.running=true
Non-Bundled Plugins: Lombook Plugin, Pythonid, com.intellij.plugins.html.instantEditing, com.leinardi.pycharm.pylint, google-java-format

Currently, IDEA lacks support of Windows Credential Manager, and Windows users are forced to use KeePass for credential storage.

We could add a support of Windows Credential Manager, please see the relevant documentation:

","created":1689364774761,"updated":1689364864668,"id":"27-7858237","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"dmitry.yudin","name":"Dmitry Yudin","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

To reproduce:

  1. Make two splitters. Keep only one tab in the second one to make it simple
  2. Switch branch
  3. Remove the second splitter if it persisted
  4. Return to a previous branch
  5. It should be "Workspace associated with branch '...' has been restored" with two splitters
  6. Move the tab from 2nd splitter to the 1st

Works fine in 231

I have no idea how to reproduce it. I just closed tabs in the right splitter one by one, but the empty splitter remained there. I'm using the nightly build, but my colleague says that he faced the issue before. So, it may not be caused by recent changes.

STR:

  1. split some editor horizontally
  2. restart IDEA
  3. close the bottom editor:

Result: exception, empty tab

IDE version used is: CLion-2023.2.tar.gz (standalone installation)
What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Invoke CLION and try open the project. It will crash in a couple of seconds in my machine.

What is the expected result?
Able to proceed and work on the project.

What happens instead?
CLION Crashes.

Thank you, I have gotten further thanks to that info. The key part was this:

Resetting GDK_SCALE to an integer value also allowed WebStorm to start normally.

A non-integer scaling factor is causing GoLand to use the "legacy IDE-managed HiDPI mode", which seems to trigger the crash. I can now get past the crash but have an unusable UI. Here is the troubleshooting I've attempted.

Working through the steps in https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007994999-HiDPI-configuration under the JBR11 section:

1. If the system scale factor is forced via -Dsun.java2d.uiScale property - it's just used.

That did not seem to be the case for me initially, although see below.

2. The following GSettings are considered (...)

I am not using gnome, but GoLand might still be picking up the value from GSettings. Checking it shows the value is unsigned integer 2 so no problems there.

bash
$ gsettings get org.gnome.desktop.interface scaling-factor                                          
uint32 2

3. If GDK_SCALE environment variable is set, (...)

GDK_SCALE and GDK_DPI_SCALE are not set:

bash
$ echo $GDK_SCALE $GDK_DPI_SCALE

$

4. If none of the above settings is defined, then the system scale is derived from the Xft.dpi value (e.g. 192 dpi will define 2.0 scale factor).

GDK_SCALE is applied to Xft.dpi as well (since 2019.2.1, see 3).

Note, currently fractional scale factor is not supported on Linux in the JRE-managed HiDPI mode. So if Xft.dpi defines a fraction scale, then the IDE is automatically switched to the legacy IDE-managed HiDPI mode (and the GDK_SCALE is not applied).

This was my Xft.dpi value:

bash
$ xrdb -q | grep -i dpi                                                                                 
Xft.dpi:        80

This would result in a scale factor of 80/192*2=0.8333.

The instructions on that page imply I can run xrandr --dpi 96 to set a scale factor of 1.0 but that doesn't work for me. Instead, I ran:

bash
$ xrdb -override /dev/stdin <<< "Xft.dpi: 96" && i3-msg restart

Where i3-msg restart restarts my window manager (without restarting my open apps). From here, the IDE would no longer crash but the font was unreadable (same as the screenshot below).

As a final test, I set the following vmoptions:

$ cat ~/.config/JetBrains/GoLand2023.2/goland64.vmoptions 
-Dcom.sun.awt.use.national.layouts=false
-Dsun.java2d.uiScale.enabled=true
-Dsun.java2d.uiScale=1

This still did not prevent the crash with a DPI of 80 set via xrdb, but I can get it to start by launching GoLand like this:

GOLAND_VM_OPTIONS=~/.config/JetBrains/GoLand2023.2 goland

The resulting UI, however, is unusable:

I have tried setting -Dide.ui.scale to a few different settings but it seems to have no effect.

Tickets","id":"113-2431","$type":"SimpleIssueCustomField"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Install goland 2023.2

  2. On first run, the IDE started fine but opening multiple projects in new windows would be missing the new title bar and menus were inaccessible (eg. Alt+f did not open the file menu)

  3. On second run, the UI font was impossibly small and unreadable. Editor font was normal.

  4. When trying the HiDPI scaling factor settings, and disabling / enabling the sun.java2d.uiScale , the exception in the title was thrown: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Width (0) and height (0) cannot be \<= 0

  5. After manually removing the new settings from ~/.config/JetBrains/GoLand2023.2/goland64.vmoptions, the crash persists.

What is the expected result?

No crash on start-up.

IDE font size appears as it did in the previous version.

Title bar / menus remain accessible from all windows, or at least remain accessible somehow when the one window that has a title bar is closed.

What happens instead?

Installed on Linux (Ubuntu 22.04) using snap. Window manager is i3wm on xorg, using one external monitor and the laptop screen is disabled.

The IDE crashes before any UI appears other than the splash screen so I can't provide logs. Attached is what is output on the terminal when running goland from there.

goland-crash.log

Installed Java version (not sure if this is relevant for snaps):

$ java -version
openjdk version "11.0.20" 2023-07-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.20+8-post-Ubuntu-1ubuntu122.04)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.20+8-post-Ubuntu-1ubuntu122.04, mixed mode, sharing)

As a workaround, 2023.1 works fine.

Hi, can you explain the problem with SVG under the hood? Our plugin totally crashed on the latest version of IntelliJ.

I replaced the relevant icons with the tool, but it kept falling in the other places on "w and h must be > 0". I then did go over all of our SVG and transformed them via the tool you suggested.

For now, it looks like it solved the problem, but we still want to understand what actually changed in the core, so it started to fall suddenly.
Another thing is what should be our action in the future when we want to add another SVG. Is there a problem with how we generated SVG? Will we have to normalize it every time with that tool? Thanks in advance.

@Dan Sela FYI

","created":1690720079834,"updated":null,"id":"27-7943539","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"lejia.chen","name":"Lejia Chen","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

@Roman Borodov Hi, we use a new library for the SVG in 2023.2 which has a bug causing this issue: https://github.com/weisJ/jsvg/issues/44
The comment above using that tool is only a workaround before we fixed on our IDEA side.

We use IconLoader.getIcon(ImagePath, Xxxx.class) to load an SVG in our plugin but that icon is not loaded properly and leads to an exception java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: Exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: w and h must be > 0 from "com.github.weisj.jsvg" code path.

Creating this issue from the ticket discussion: https://jbs.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/5217908

Plugin in question: https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/12637-rookout/versions/stable/343068

There is an issue with icon that does not load properly and leads to an exception. Here is the comment from the plugin authors:

However, that leads to concern as we will not be able to represent UI as we intended. Can you please clarify if it is a known bug, or,  in case it is not your area of responsibility, can you address us to the person who can help to find the solution?
Thank you and have a wonderful day.

Below is the detailed description of the error:

We have a class which is responsible for the icons loading. Class has static initialization and is used as a static service.
Below we are declaring the variable of the LayeredIcon class:

public class RookoutIcons {
    public static final LayeredIcon ROOKOUT_BREAKPOINT_DISABLED = new LayeredIcon(2);
    ...
}

Then we have a static initialisation in which we are calling the method setIcon of class LayeredIcon. The OUR_ICON is being statically initialized before and doesn't throw any errors:

static {
    ...
    ROOKOUT_BREAKPOINT_DISABLED.setIcon(OUR_ICON, 0);
        ...
}

So after trying to narrow down the error in runtime, we found out what this line is throwing the error. Below the stack trace from the setIcon method.

 java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: Exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: w and h must be > 0 [in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0"]

Messages tool window has been replaced by Build and Problems tool window. Can you please describe the steps to reproduce and the expected and the actual result? Please attach screenshot of the tool window you want to be opened. Do you use Maven, Gradle for project build? Thank you.

","created":1651749181375,"updated":null,"id":"27-6056074","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Aaron-Ritter-IDEXX","name":"Aaron Ritter","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

For me, it's not Maven or Gradle but rather Ant. After running a build, the "problems" window is empty. I don't see any option here for a "build" window, nor a "build and problems" one.

I can open the "messages" window, but when starting another ant build, it disappears.

I have the same version of IntelliJ as does Jocke.

","created":1652110420365,"updated":null,"id":"27-6061516","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"adernov","name":"Andrey Dernov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Reproduced: after running Ant task, the Messages tool window will automatically hide.

","created":1652191530241,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063082","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"adernov","name":"Andrey Dernov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Regression in 2022.1: it will is not hidden in 2021.3 version.

","created":1652191587388,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063084","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"jeka","name":"Eugene Zhuravlev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

What are build execution properties for your build:

If "Make build in background" is chosen, the messages window should not pop-up, if there were no errors during the build. But that does not mean it is automatically hides, it just has not been initially shown. Is this what you mean?

","created":1652193662364,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063161","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"adernov","name":"Andrey Dernov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Yes, for me Make build in background option was enabled. Disabling it helps - Messages window will appear.

The difference is that in 2021.3 version, the Messages tool button stripe for this tool window would still be visible in the 1st case even though the tool window will not be shown. In 2022.1 version, the tool window stripe button will not be displayed. Not sure if this is expected behaviour (cc @Vladimir Krivosheev?)

","created":1652197073272,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063284","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Aaron-Ritter-IDEXX","name":"Aaron Ritter","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Indeed, in the current version...

  • when that option is disabled, the messages window opens both upon running a build and upon the build completing
  • when that option is enabled, the messages window closes upon running a build, disappearing from the stripe at the bottom of the window. To view the build output. you must re-open it from the menu.

In earlier versions, my preferred behavior...

  • when that option is enabled, and if it was minimized to the stripe at the bottom of the window, it stayed there. To view the build output, you could click on it on the stripe. I think it would also open if the build failed.
  • I never tried the option disabled, so I don't know what it did then.
","created":1652207818089,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063551","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"jeka","name":"Eugene Zhuravlev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

So the real problem is:

"the Messages pane is not visible in the Toolwindow stripe upon build start and the only way to access it, if build has no errors, is from the main menu"

","created":1652250424183,"updated":null,"id":"27-6063866","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"adernov","name":"Andrey Dernov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

[IDEA webhelp] issue with page "Executing_Build_File_in_Background.html" version "2022.2"
https://jbs.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/4236196

The default behavior was changed to always build in the background. This is extremely frustrating because the change to not build in the background is lost with every version upgrade. This means I have to remember to manually change it in dozens of projects every few weeks - not to mention having to remind all of my developers to do the same.

","created":1660904896772,"updated":null,"id":"27-6400696","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"markusna","name":"Markus Näher","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Shouldn't the view mode "Dock Pinned" ensure it never disappears from the stripe, regardless if it automatically opens or not?

","created":1660926563620,"updated":null,"id":"27-6401752","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Aaron-Ritter-IDEXX","name":"Aaron Ritter","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Interestingly, it doesn't even exist until some messages have been output. This is the list of tool windows when the IDE is launched.

Its mode is already set to "Dock Pinned" by default.

So, here's my hypothesis: The messages panel is being destroyed, and a new one created, when an Ant build is run. That would (sort of) explain it not existing on startup of IntelliJ, and it would explain it disappearing when you run a build despite being pinned.

","created":1661533635841,"updated":1663794949960,"id":"27-6415189","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"adernov","name":"Andrey Dernov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

https://jbs.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/4977418

As I said, the messages window disappears when the build completes. If I bring it up again by using view->tool windows->messages, the window is empty. This leads me to believe that the window has been destroyed as described in the issue I sent.

Turning off 'Make build in background' does help in idea 2.2.5, however. In this case I don't have to manually open the messages window.

I think at this point I'm waiting for the bug IDEA-293560 to get resolved in 2.3.3. Is there anything you can do to raise the priority of the issue?

","created":1680163102164,"updated":null,"id":"27-7059597","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"pete.haidinyak","name":"Pete Haidinyak","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

This is still in the latest build as of 4/6/2023 and it is rather irritating

The reindexing issue from WI-72072 started occurring again after update to 2023.2 specifically (previous small updates did not affect anything). I had to rename the folder of my project, then remove the "invalid" project from IDE's list, rename it back again, and reopen for the issue to go away.

Don't know if this is relevant for this bug, but since WI-72072 was closed as duplicate, posting this here.

E.g. it should check if the class name mentioned in plugin.XML is compatible with the corresponding extension interface, and print the clear error message "the class name a.b.X mentioned in plugin.xml:123 does not implement interface x.y.ExtInterface", to help plugin writers deal with issues like EA-893964 CCE: LanguageInjectionPerformerAdapter.getLanguagesToInject (https://jb-web.exa.aws.intellij.net/issue/893964):

","created":1688352352994,"updated":1688354002963,"id":"27-7635812","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Matthias_Vdb","name":"MatthiasV","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

@Dmitrii Tsygankov,

As far as I am able to make out, it does seem like the inspections are running without issue. That said, any warning/error always makes us a bit unsure (e.g. [IDEA-316408] could've had an impact, even thought it was logged as a warning). Perhaps the warnings aren't an issue, but at the very least they do make the build log cluttered if one is looking for an actual problem. Other warning messages you may find in the build log have also been reported: [TW-82361].

I have attached (limited view access) the full build log and associated kotlin-style configuration for the Inspections run build step. This was a normal build log from the past night; if I have to add some JVM parameter for additional verbose output, let me know (what to add) and I'll do another run.

Regards,
~ Matthias

Following this warning, there are a number of related warnings that all boil down to java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.sun.jna.Native.

I have checked the "Parameters" of the build, and they do not contain an env.IDE_HOME entry (env.JAVA_HOME and such are present). I've checked the build agent, and the files do seem to be at C:\TeamCity\buildAgent\tools\intellij.IU-223.8836.41\lib\jna\amd64, so I can only assume the Inspections run step isn't setting the env.IDE_HOME to the path of the installed IntelliJ Tools used to run the Inspections?

What can we do to fix this problem?

Regards,
~ Matthias

IDEA-288377

doesn't allow to set certain SVG images as a Project Icon","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"jonathanlermitage.1","name":"jonathan lermitage","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Recent IntelliJ releases use JSVG in order to display SVG files. I guess the Toolbox is still using the previous solution (based on Batik, or something else ?). It could explain why you see an error in IntelliJ but not in the Toolbox.

Meanwhile, there is no ideal solution. I have similar problem, but in the Toolbox only (bad rendering, colour is lost). So, as a workaround, you may want to open the SVG file and see what's wrong / not supported, and file a bug to https://github.com/weisJ/jsvg/issues.

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Open a Project
  2. Right-click on the header and select "Change Project Icon..."
    1.
  3. Assign "espresso-icon.svg" (attached) as Project Icon
  4. Observe that nothing in the header has changed
  5. Close the IDEA
  6. Every time the project is re-opened the IDEA displays "IDE error occurred" popup and shows "IDE Internal Errors" dialog (stacktrace.txt attached)
  7. The IDE header has empty placeholder in place where the Icon is supposed to be.

What is the expected result?

  • The Project Icon is displayed in the header

Additional details

It's strange, but after setting the Icon the Toolbox App shows that SVG icon properly. The same SVG file is also correctly displayed by browsers and other image vievers:

@Stanislav Lashmanov Thanks for reporting this issue.
I tried to create a new project in the WSL2 path, changed some IDE settings, restart the IDE but I still can't reproduce this issue.
Do you have any reliable steps that can reproduce this issue?

","created":1616137264596,"updated":1616137285588,"id":"27-4775545","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"cyberap","name":"Stanislav Lashmanov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Unfortunately no, it happens occasionally, I can restart IDEA multiple times and have it work perfectly fine, but on another day it will corrupt the workspace.xml. I can try and copy workspace.xml before opening IDEA to get the idea why it might be corrupted, but that's probably the best I can do in this case.

","created":1629136107517,"updated":null,"id":"27-5123733","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"pete.edwards","name":"Pete Edwards","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

For me it happens in IntelliJ Ultimate in WSL2 with node projects (no docker). It seems to be related to shutting down the computer with instances of IntelliJ still running. I tend to stop the application being run to make the shutdown faster but that is not enough. It would probably be solved by closing IntelliJ before I shutdown Windows but that doesn't suit the way I work - I have 2 projects open at once and like the fact that when I start IntelliJ after a reboot, it opens both. If I close them manually I will need to open them individually. That might sound a little petty but I'm reporting it in case it helps get to the bottom of the issue. It doesn't happen too often so it is the trade off between the convenience of opening both projects at once vs the annoyance of sometimes having to reset the node interpreter and resize panels.

","created":1642163564389,"updated":null,"id":"27-5702096","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"xbb","name":"Nicola","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Sometimes after Windows startup my project workspace is reset.

The project is stored in the WSL2 filesystem, WSL2 is started before PHPSTORM.

What happens (in my case) is the ProjectId in the project local workspace (.idea/workspace.xml) file is changed.

If you have the same issue as me, you can get your settings back by restoring the previous ProjectId value.

Close the IDE and look in the folder AppData\\Roaming\\JetBrains\\PhpStorm2021.3\\workspace, sort the files by time, note the size too, the name of one of those files is the correct ProjectId for your project, open them if you are not sure which one is it.

Edit: happened again, checked the event log immediately and I see the same Cannot load settings from file .... workspace.xml: content truncated

To me this issue happenes on a daily basis. It always affects the first IDE I start after booting my computer. Sometimes even multiple files in the .idea folder are affected. I will try opening an wsl terminal before starting my IDE to initialize wsl or whatever. Will see if that prevents the error. My stupid workaround is to just backup the whole .idea folder to a zip file and to unzip it whenever the error occurs.

","created":1643780770364,"updated":1643780880365,"id":"27-5733135","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"jana","name":"Jana Kalfařová","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Same issue happens to me. I use Win11 + WSL2 + PhpStorm 2021.1.4. I always start up WSL before I open PhpStorm and I always close PhpStorm before I shut down my laptop. It's been happening every few weeks.

Actually, now I think about it, it usually happens when I reboot my computer because my WSL command line stops working. Is it possible that something happens before the reboot?

","created":1645169225035,"updated":null,"id":"27-5792814","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Samantha.Adrichem","name":"Samantha Adrichem","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Just had this happen the first time on the latest

Build #PS-222.3345.135, built on July 28, 2022

Licensed to Daisycon / Samantha Adrichem
Subscription is active until September 19, 2022.

Runtime version: 17.0.3+7-b469.32 amd64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o.

The file is actually completely empty if I check it on my hard drive, so there is no way to undo it either or prevent PHPStorm to overwrite it.

I would recommend (if PHPStorm is the one that truncates it during this message), to store / show the broken version. That way we can check what's wrong.

Honestly would not be surprised if it just takes too long to respond or that it was still locked or something and that the file itself would be fine.

","created":1689586246296,"updated":1689588218328,"id":"27-7865379","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Massimo_De_Facci","name":"massimo.defacci","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Win11 + WSL2 + PHPStorm

This happened to me multiple times last week, after downloading the new update.

I noticed this was happening after I closed PHPStorm and almost immediatly shutting down/restarting, so I tried waiting a minute before doing that and the problem didnt appear again. While I cant actually prove it prevents the problem I suggest doing so, just to be on the safe side.

I believe it might be something akin to wsl2 taking some time actually saving the project files and windows shutting down the virtual machine before it finishes.

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Configure your project in WSL2
  2. Re-launch IDEA

What is the expected result?

Settings should persist

What happens instead?

Settings could randomly break on launch with a message content truncated.

This happens for me on both IDEA and WebStorm, both last stable and beta versions.

I've attached logs from the beta IDEA I am currently working on, but the IDE version doesn't matter in my case.

This is a major issue for me because I am forced to configure my projects from scratch from time to time and this significantly degrades my developer experience. Really hope this could be fixed, thank you.

","tags":[],"id":"25-4678708","$type":"Issue","workItems":[]}, {"created":1690642922220,"resolved":null,"attachments":[{"url":"/api/files/74-1880265?sign=MTY5MTg4NDgwMDAwMHwxMS0xNzYwfDc0LTE4ODAyNjV8b0w1VWlrand5YnVDSE10Zms3RmxsM1Fw%0D%0AWkRnNnFKOXp3Z29PNTBZNTRCSQ0K%0D%0A&updated=1690739825455","name":"Screenshot 2023-07-30 at 14.51.13.png","$type":"IssueAttachment"}],"project":{"shortName":"IJPL","$type":"Project"},"updated":1690822295365,"reporter":{"login":"develar","$type":"User"},"summary":"rw lock impl is removed from ApplicationImpl — profile impact and do we still need to wait for AWT toolkit/IdeEventQueue init","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"develar","name":"Vladimir Krivosheev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

We cannot pass lock to ApplicationImpl ctor, because it is package-local. Moreover, I do not set what we can do here — we have to create an AWT toolkit to have a Swing thread for creating RW lock. And our IdeEventQueue instantiation is already optimized (we have metrics).

","created":1690698284030,"updated":null,"id":"27-7943122","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"develar","name":"Vladimir Krivosheev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

No, we should set rw lock in ApplicationImpl.postInit and call this method as later as possible (after telementry int, service container init and store init). Mostly all was fixed in May (ability to execute low level start-up service container dependent code without global Application (ApplicationManager.getApplication returns null)).

Not reproduced in: #IU-232.8660.185

STR:

  1. Open the Welcome screen
  2. Open File or Help menu
  3. Click the same menu item several times more
  4. Move cursor to another menu item

Result:
Menu items disappear (expect Help menu | Search):

In my case, it only sometimes throws some exceptions like the below:

I'm using an SVG as project icon and it includes a style tag with a media query that make this icon usable in the browser with light mode and dark mode. It looks like this:

path.black {
  fill: black;
}

@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) {
  path.black {
    fill: white;
  }
}

It would be so awesome if that media query was respected by the JetBrains IDEs depending on if you're using a light or dark theme in the header (rest of the editor doesn't matter in this case) and also in the toolbox app wether it's using light mode or dark mode.

#IU-232.8660.185

  1. Open a project with default inspection settings
  2. Disable any inspection

Result: /.idea/inspectionProfiles/Project_Default.xml is not created
Requires reopening the project / restarting IDE or pressing Cmd + S directly, switching focus from the IDE window to another application doesn't help, nor does switching tabs

This may not be reproduced every time, but you can repeat the steps and it will happen at some point. It's also not necessary to open the project with the default inspection settings, but I think it's more likely to reproduce that way

@Vladimir Krivosheev we have a lot of dups for this request in MPS project with 2022.3 platform. Can we somehow help you to investigate and fix this problem?

","created":1683206153997,"updated":null,"id":"27-7311097","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"venca","name":"Vaclav Pech","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

@Vladimir Krivosheev For MPS the problem was that our ContextActions tool window registered incorrectly with the tool window manager. So the blame is on us, not the platform. One thing I would possibly suggest to the platform is to provide a more descriptive error message when the tool window detects that a tool window has been registered before the tool window manager got initialized.

","tags":[],"id":"25-4014405","$type":"Issue","workItems":[]}, {"created":1687768237122,"resolved":null,"attachments":[],"project":{"shortName":"IDEA","$type":"Project"},"updated":1690365593695,"reporter":{"login":"Alexander_Jeckmans","$type":"User"},"summary":"IDEA should be able to start successfully even if the IDE fails to load a plugin on startup due to exception in PluginClassLoader.loadClass","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Dotnet_Team","name":"Dotnet Team","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Thank you for your request. This page offers descriptions of the various issue states to help you track your request’s progress through our workflow: https://rider-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021572199-YouTrack-issue-states-and-their-description

","created":1687768237190,"updated":null,"id":"27-7537444","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Alexander_Jeckmans","name":"Alexander Jeckmans","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Also, with the latest sonarlint plugin version it is working fine. So it might have something to do with an API change between whatever 8.2.0.68615 was targeted against and 8.3.0.71062 is now targeting against.

","created":1687768419592,"updated":1687768453583,"id":"27-7537677","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"dmitry.kazantsev","name":"Dmitry Kazantsev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Hello Alexander,

Do I understand you correct that updating SonarLink plugin to the latest version solved the problem?

","created":1687794490511,"updated":null,"id":"27-7550388","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Alexander_Jeckmans","name":"Alexander Jeckmans","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Well if by updating you mean I had to go into the install folder, find the plugin and remove it by hand, then yes :)

With the older version installed the UI wouldn't start. It would immediately go into a java error prompt, so not an ideal situation, because there is no way to recover from it besides manually correcting the issue through the file system.

","created":1687794966590,"updated":null,"id":"27-7550642","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"dmitry.kazantsev","name":"Dmitry Kazantsev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Hello Alexander,

As we can see, the error states java.lang.RuntimeException: Cannot invoke (class=InitializeSonarLintOnStartup,
I suggest trying to install the latest version of the plugin (8.4.0.73538) into Rider 2022.1.3 or EAP 6 to see if that helps.
If still the issue persists, we recommend you to contact the plugin vendor.

","created":1687874781175,"updated":null,"id":"27-7586509","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Alexander_Jeckmans","name":"Alexander Jeckmans","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Hi @Dmitry Kazantsev, as stated earlier, updating the plugin and/or updating rider works. It is specifically this combination that did not work. I do however feel this is not an issue for the vendor per se. In my opinion, no plugin should ever cause a crash on startup of the IDE and prevent it from ever showing the UI or otherwise starting correctly. That points to a lack of robustness during plugin loading, which is why I even opened this issue in the first place.

","created":1687876732691,"updated":null,"id":"27-7587890","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"dmitry.kazantsev","name":"Dmitry Kazantsev","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

Hello IDEA Team,

The initial issue is solved by either updating Rider or plugin. Now the talk is about an improvement of plugin initialization: not to crash an IDE if a plugin was not initialized due to error in it.

The initial issue is solved by either updating IDEA or the plugin. But this isssue is about an improvement of plugin initialization: not to crash an IDE if a plugin was not initialized due to an error in it.
No plugin should ever cause a crash on startup of the IDE and prevent it from ever showing the UI or otherwise starting correctly. That points to a lack of robustness during plugin loading.

Example:
The IDE fails to start due to an internal error (e.g. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException when loading an old sonarlint plugin).

Expect:
IDE starts successfully even if it fails to load that plugin.

old title: Internal error on startup, related to sonarlint plugin
What steps will reproduce the issue?

No idea, I'd wager something like installing the sonarlint plugin in 2023.2 EAP 5 and starting Rider.

What is the expected result?

Rider to start :)

What happens instead?

Internal error and Rider fails to start up.
Removing the sonarlint plugin resolves the issue.

Attachments:

Internal error. Please refer to https://jb.gg/ide/critical-startup-errors

","created":1648723902327,"updated":1648807134934,"id":"27-5950620","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"arina.efremova","name":"Arina Efremova","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

@Vladimir Krivosheev - any plans to fix this?

https://jbs.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/3987224

We've had some complains from developers that they keep getting a proxy authentication required popup when they open/close IntelliJ and after using Intellij for a couple of hours. It looks similar to https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-140044/Proxy-authentication-is-requested-although-%22remember-password%22-i. The proxy settings are required for reaching our Jetbrains License server so that is why I opened a ticket here.
It's a minor annoyance that is shared by +- 60 developers in our organisation (for some more than others). I was hoping that addressing this with this form, on our customer account, might help prioritising this issue and it's semi-related to licensing. A normal "solution" would be to disable the proxy settings in IntelliJ but that is not possible because it's required for reaching the license server.

This issue is related to the 'dynamic plugins' feature which we are trying to implement for our plugin.

We recently made our plugin TeXiFy-IDEA able to unload (https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-241956), there is still a problem with the update process: when updating, inspection settings (for example, disabling an inspection) saved in IDE Default or in a custom project-level profile, are deleted when updating.
I believe this happens because these settings are removed on plugin unload, and not put back after restarting.

(The update still asks for a restart after updating most of the time, though not always. I know this should not be the case, but there are no hprof files generated anymore so I think there is something else wrong application-level in our unloading process. Still have to debug that properly. In the log I still see IllegalArgumentException: Trying to access element type from unloaded plugin: tombstone of COMMAND_TOKEN)

The problem is not there when updating from a file, I believe because then there is no unloading process but the update happens in the way before the dynamic plugins feature, with a restart.

My question is, is it the responsibility of the plugin to figure out settings like this during unloading, to apply them back after loading?

I couldn't find any information about this at https://jetbrains.org/intellij/sdk/docs/basics/plugin_structure/dynamic_plugins.html

I also don't know of any other dynamic plugins which have inspections, it would be helpful to see if they have the same problem.

Template info:

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Install an older version of TeXiFy-IDEA
  2. Disable an inspection, save for example in a custom profile
  3. Update TeXiFy-IDEA
  4. See the 'unloading' progress bar, and then see the setting disappear from the xml
  5. Restart when asked to

What is the expected result?

Inspection stays disabled.

What happens instead?

Inspection is enabled again.

The attached idea.log is from right after an update without restart, so one where the unloading process happened to work properly. Updated from 0.7-rc2 to 0.7-rc3.

  • open build.gradle and change dependencies from testImplementation to implementation
","created":1686658669820,"updated":null,"id":"27-7451529","$type":"IssueComment"},{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"Alexey.Merkulov","name":"Alexey Merkulov","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

I suspect that the problem comes from mutable ElementBase.ElementIconRequest#myPointer content. Maybe it can change the self hash-code. I would propose to store its hash code as the field in the ElementBase.ElementIconRequest . And add the check that it is not changing with the report when it is changing.

According to the logs there was a freeze on January 24 which prevented OS restart, user had to kill IDE which caused full reindexing on next re-open

https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/4405279985810-Total-re-index-after-crash?page=1#community_comment_9635672888082
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-271911/IDEA-is-re-indexing-everything-after-system-crash#focus=Comments-27-6804614.0-0

Unless you found out the cause is the same of course, then disregard this comment.

Kotlin: 213-1.5.10-release-949-IJ7172.25

I am unable to restore the window to a usable size. Where are window positions and sizes stored?

EDIT: I found it in ~/Library/Application\ Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2021.3/options/window.state.xml.

I changed the height attribute of component with name WindowManager. It was set to 1 and I changed it to 500. Oddly, this did not actually produce a main window with specified size either - but at least now I could grab it with the mouse and resize it. I confirmed that the above height attribute got updated by that, so it is the right place.

I cannot think of any serious use case for the height of the main window to be below a threshold that at least lets you resize it to a workable height again. Maybe this could be a quick fix?

I experienced this issue recently, here is my info:

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.3 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-212.5457.46, built on October 12, 2021

Runtime version: 11.0.12+7-b1504.40 x86_64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o.
macOS 12.6.3
GC: G1 Young Generation, G1 Old Generation
Memory: 2048M
Cores: 8
Non-Bundled Plugins: DuplicateLines (1.0.1), com.vnea.intellij.plugin.quickly-change-editor-font-size-preference (1.1.3), Key Promoter X (2021.3), IdeaVIM (1.8.1), Pythonid (212.5457.59), aws.toolkit (1.34-212)

I think this was caused when I restarted my laptop as @Tatiana Shabaeva mentioned, so this should be reproducible.

open IDE
put mac to sleep. at some point macOS reboots due to a problem (happens quite often for me on Catalina)
after macOS restarts all apps, find IDE window -> see the problem

The solution mentioned by @Karim Sonbol worked for me.

Opening IntelliJ, opening Window menu then "Zoom" option brings the window back to life!

I was also able to resize the window once I found it on my screen (it was a small line). You can find it by pressing Ctrl + down arrow and watching the window animation.

What steps will reproduce the issue?

  1. Restart IntelliJ
  2. Note that the window has no height

What is the expected result?
Window is restored to it's previous dimensions (in my case, the screen size). See screenshot.

This doesn't always occur, but fairly frequently since upgrading to 2018.1 projects reopen with this problem.

ide.experimental.ui=true
Kotlin: 232-1.8.21-release-380-IJ5096

STR:

  1. Open Java project named Untitled2, open code file Main.java in the Editor.
  2. Invoke Ctrl+Alt+Shift+S (Project Structure), rename project to Untitled23 -> Window title updated, taskbar on hover still shows Untitled2 - Main.java.
  3. Close all Editor tabs.
  4. Invoke Ctrl+Alt+Shift+S (Project Structure), rename project to Untitled234 -> Window title updated, taskbar on hover also shown changed project name.
  5. Open Main.java again, rename project back to Untitled23 -> Window title updated, taskbar again shows Untitled2 - Main.java.

Sometimes I press "Select opened file"

and nothing happens for seconds. After that navigation is actually performed, but during this time I have no idea what is going on, am I already navigated? or idea is broken and the button doesn't work?

I expect to have some kid of progress indicator at that moment, like a modal progress indicator, backround progress indicator or just a button/cursor spinner or any other marker that action is currently executing.

","tags":[],"id":"25-4663930","$type":"Issue","workItems":[]}, {"created":1667573990962,"resolved":null,"attachments":[{"url":"/api/files/74-1488079?sign=MTY5MTg4NDgwMDAwMHwxMS0xNzYwfDc0LTE0ODgwNzl8YUhtZ1lZVnhjTTY3THFzME9feU82S29y%0D%0AdE5pTDN0N1plb3FvS2s3ZGVlRQ0K%0D%0A&updated=1667573902959","name":"Screen Recording 2022-11-04 at 16.45.02.mov","$type":"IssueAttachment"}],"project":{"shortName":"IDEA","$type":"Project"},"updated":1689590335197,"reporter":{"login":"olga.lavrenteva","$type":"User"},"summary":"Editor tab is not focused after IDE restart","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"shalom938","name":"shalom Ben Zvi","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

can reproduce this issue or something like it almost 90% of the times on startup. the editor that looks in the front does not fire selectionChanged event until you click it or change the IDE window to another window and back, cause it to loose focus and gain focus again. We have a plugin that relies on selectionChanged , I use linux and i experience it always, my colleagues use mac or windows and they never complained about it, it is very obvious because our plugin changes the tool window content on selection changed.
you can see in the video that our tool windows shows info for OwnerController although VisitController looks in the front. without touching the IDE i switch window and back and only then the selectionChanged in fired.
